votebox.middle

Class Properties

  • java.lang.Object
    • votebox.middle.Properties

  • public class Properties
extends java.lang.Object
    The properties class is used to store, in the state of any ballot or layout object, properties that are declared in the corresponding XML file. When ballot or layout objects are parsed, any time a "Property" or "ListProperty" tag is encountered, the mapping defined in the tag is stored in the instance of this class that is held by parent ballot or layout object. This allows for these properties to be easily checked at any time.

      Set this property on a card to set the "strategy" that the card uses for the behavior of CardElement selection and deselection.
      static java.lang.String DOWN
      This property references the UID of the element that is laid out below this element.
      static java.lang.String INITIAL_SELECTED
      Set this property on a card to make an element be selected initially (before a voter has touched it).
      static java.lang.String K
      Cards can have this property set to denote k in kofn in reference to KofN voting, or voting in races where a certain number (k) of candidates can be selected out of all the candidates in the race (n).

      Set this property on a toggle button to choose which language is selected.
      static java.lang.String LANGUAGES
      Set this property on a ballot to enable a specific language.
      static java.lang.String LEFT
      This property references the UID of the element that is laid out to the left of this element.
      static java.lang.String LIE
      Set this property on a card to either "non" or "cand" to enable lying and to set which type of lying should be done.

      • PAGE_NUMBER

        public static final java.lang.String PAGE_NUMBER
        Often, one will need to define a page number to correlate with another assignment. For instance, the "go to page" button strategy will need a page number to which it should "go."

      • RACE_GROUP

        public static final java.lang.String RACE_GROUP
        Set this property to a list of race-ids to indicate the group of race-ids that compose the race on this card. In the event that a race spans multiple cards, the FIRST card should contain this property and it should be omitted on all subsequent cards in the race.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String key,
       java.lang.String value,
       java.lang.String type)
         throws UnknownTypeException,
                UnknownFormatException
        This method adds a key and value to the properties dictionary. The key must be of the type which is defined in the "type" attribute of the property that is being added.
        Parameters:
        key - Add this key to the dictionary
        value - Set this value for key
        type - This is value's type. It must be one of {"Integer","Boolean","String"}
        Throws:
        UnknownTypeException - This method throws if type is not one of {"Integer","Boolean","String"}
        UnknownFormatException - This method throws if value cannot be decoded, given that its type is the type parameter.

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String key,
       java.util.List<java.lang.String> values,
       java.lang.String type)
         throws UnknownTypeException,
                UnknownFormatException
        Add a list type property. A list type, rather than mapping a key to a single value, maps it to a collection of values. These values must all be of the same type.
        Parameters:
        key - Map the given values to this key.
        values - Map these values.
        type - The values inside the collection are of this type (one of String, Integer). Note that boolean is not allowed.
        Throws:
        UnknownTypeException - This method throws if type is not one of {"Integer","String"}
        UnknownFormatException - This method throws if value cannot be decoded, given that its type is the type parameter.

      • getObject

        public java.lang.Object getObject(java.lang.String key)
        This method gets the value associated with a given key.
        Parameters:
        key - This is the key for which a value will be returned.
        Returns:
        This method returns the value associated with key if there is one, or null if there isn't. This method offers no guarentees about the type returned. associated with the key

        public java.lang.Integer getInteger(java.lang.String key)
                             throws IncorrectTypeException
        This method gets the value associated with a given key.
        Parameters:
        key - This is the key for which a value will be returned.
        Returns:
        This method returns the value associated with key if there is one, or null if there isn't. This method guarentees that the value returned is of type Integer.
        Throws:
        IncorrectTypeException - This method throws if the object associated with key is not of the type Integer.

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String key)
        Call this method to check if a given property has been set.
        Parameters:
        key - This is the key for the given property.
        Returns:
        This method returns true of the property has been set (has an assigned value) or false if it has not been.
